remarks.format: ## Remarks 泛型类是一个数组的键/值对，O (log `n`) 检索，其中 n 是字典中的元素数。The generic class is an array of key/value pairs with O(log `n`) retrieval, where n is the number of elements in the dictionary. 在此，它是类似于泛型类。In this, it is similar to the generic class. 两个类具有相似的对象模型，并且都具有 O (log `n`) 检索。The two classes have similar object models, and both have O(log `n`) retrieval. 两个类的不同之处是在内存使用和插入和删除的速度：Where the two classes differ is in memory use and speed of insertion and removal: - 使用更少的内存比。 uses less memory than . - 具有更快的插入和删除操作的未排序的数据，O (log `n`) 而不是 O (`n`) 的。 has faster insertion and removal operations for unsorted data, O(log `n`) as opposed to O(`n`) for . - 如果从已排序的数据，同时填充列表快于。If the list is populated all at once from sorted data, is faster than . 另一个区别并类是支持高效的键和值通过返回的集合的索引的检索和属性。Another difference between the and classes is that supports efficient indexed retrieval of keys and values through the collections returned by the and properties. 不需要时重新生成这些列表访问的属性，因为列表是内部数组的键和值只是包装器。It is not necessary to regenerate the lists when the properties are accessed, because the lists are just wrappers for the internal arrays of keys and values. 下面的代码演示如何使用属性执行索引检索的字符串的排序列表中的值：The following code shows the use of the property for indexed retrieval of values from a sorted list of strings: 每个元素都可以作为对象。Each element can be retrieved as a object. 密钥对象必须是固定不变，只要它们被用作键在。Key objects must be immutable as long as they are used as keys in the . 中的所有密钥必须是唯一的。Every key in a must be unique. remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 字典中使用的内部树的排序顺序维护。The dictionary is maintained in a sorted order using an internal tree. 每个新元素放置在正确的排序位置处并对树进行调整时移除元素时维护排序顺序。Every new element is positioned at the correct sort position, and the tree is adjusted to maintain the sort order whenever an element is removed. 枚举，时维护排序顺序。While enumerating, the sort order is maintained. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 之前， 返回相同的对象。 returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 无法再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素；必须改为创建新的枚举器实例。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator instance instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 集合中的默认实现不同步。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation.

C#语言中使用[ `this` ](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md)关键字来定义而不是实现索引器属性。The C# language uses the [`this`](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md) keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the property. Visual Basic 将 实现为默认属性，该属性提供相同的索引功能。Visual Basic implements as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality. 检索此属性的值是 O (log `n`) 操作，其中 n 是。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(log `n`) operation, where n is . 将属性设置为 O (log `n`) 操作，如果键已存在于。Setting the property is an O(log `n`) operation if the key is already in the . 如果键不在列表中，将属性设置为 O (`n`) 操作的未排序的数据或 O (log `n`) 如果在列表的末尾添加了新元素。If the key is not in the list, setting the property is an O(`n`) operation for unsorted data, or O(log `n`) if the new element is added at the end of the list. 如果插入导致大小调整，运算复杂度为 O (`n`)。If insertion causes a resize, the operation is O(`n`). ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用属性 （C# 中的索引器） 来检索值，从而演示请求的键不存在，以及可以替换与某个键相关联的值时引发。The following code example uses the property (the indexer in C#) to retrieve values, demonstrating that a is thrown when a requested key is not present, and showing that the value associated with a key can be replaced. 该示例还演示如何使用方法作为更高效的方法来检索值，如果程序必须经常尝试在已排序的列表中不。The example also shows how to use the method as a more efficient way to retrieve values if a program often must try key values that are not in the sorted list. 此代码示例是为提供一个更大示例的一部分类。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 集合中的默认实现不同步。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 属性返回一个对象，可用于同步对。The property returns an object that can be used to synchronize access to the . 同步是所有线程访问集合之前都锁定此对象时才有效。Synchronization is effective only if all threads lock this object before accessing the collection. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此外可以使用属性来添加新元素不存在的键的值设置在字典中; 例如， `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`。You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the dictionary; for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`. 但是，如果在字典中已存在指定的键，则将设置属性将会覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the dictionary, setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反，方法不会修改现有元素。In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements. 此方法为 O (`n`) 操作对于未排序数据，其中`n`是。This method is an O(`n`) operation for unsorted data, where `n` is . 它是 O (log `n`) 操作，如果在列表的末尾添加了新元素。It is an O(log `n`) operation if the new element is added at the end of the list. 如果插入导致大小调整，运算复杂度为 O (`n`)。If insertion causes a resize, the operation is O(`n`). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何访问类通过接口。The following code example shows how to access the class through the interface. 代码示例创建一个空的字符串与字符串键，并使用方法来添加一些元素。The code example creates an empty of strings with string keys and uses the method to add some elements. 该示例演示方法会抛出时尝试添加重复的键，或提供的密钥或错误的数据类型的值时。The example demonstrates that the method throws an when attempting to add a duplicate key, or when a key or value of the wrong data type is supplied. 代码示例演示如何将多个其他成员的接口。The code example demonstrates the use of several other members of the interface. remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 集合中的默认实现不同步。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何通过使用枚举已排序的列表中的键/值对`foreach`语句 (`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中`for each`c + + 中)，从而隐藏了枚举器的使用。The following code example shows how to enumerate the key/value pairs in the sorted list by using the `foreach` statement (`For Each` in Visual Basic, `for each` in C++), which hides the use of the enumerator. 具体而言，请注意，枚举数接口返回对象而非对象。In particular, note that the enumerator for the interface returns objects rather than objects. 代码示例摘自一个更大的示例，包括输出中，为提供方法。The code example is part of a larger example, including output, provided for the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有固定大小的集合在创建之后不能再添加或移除元素，但是允许修改现有元素。A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements after the collection is created, but it allows the modification of existing elements. 具有固定大小的集合只是一个集合与防止添加和移除元素; 的包装器因此，如果在更改基础集合，包括添加或删除的元素，大小固定集合反映了这些更改。A collection with a fixed size is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents adding and removing elements; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, including the addition or removal of elements, the fixed-size collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在创建只读集合后，该集合不允许添加、移除或修改元素。A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created. 集合是只读的只是一个集合与可防止修改集合; 的包装器因此，如果对基础集合进行更改，只读集合反映了这些更改。A collection that is read-only is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents modifying the collection; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, the read-only collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性返回`null`如果`key`不能赋给键的类型的类型`TKey`的。This property returns `null` if `key` is of a type that is not assignable to the key type `TKey` of the . 可以使用下面的语法通过此属性访问集合中的特定元素：`myCollection[key]`。This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: `myCollection[key]`. 此外可以使用属性来添加新元素不存在的键的值设置在字典中; 例如， `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`。You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the dictionary; for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`. 但是，如果在字典中已存在指定的键，则将设置属性将会覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the dictionary, setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反，方法不会修改现有元素。In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements. 使用 C# 语言[这](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md)关键字来定义而不是实现索引器属性。The C# language uses the [this](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md) keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the property. Visual Basic 将 实现为默认属性，该属性提供相同的索引功能。Visual Basic implements as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality. 检索此属性的值是 O (log `n`) 操作，其中 n 是。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(log `n`) operation, where n is . 将属性设置为 O (log `n`) 操作，如果键已存在于。Setting the property is an O(log `n`) operation if the key is already in the . 如果键不在列表中，将属性设置为 O (`n`) 操作的未排序的数据或 O (log `n`) 如果在列表的末尾添加了新元素。If the key is not in the list, setting the property is an O(`n`) operation for unsorted data, or O(log `n`) if the new element is added at the end of the list. 如果插入导致大小调整，运算复杂度为 O (`n`)。If insertion causes a resize, the operation is O(`n`). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用的属性 （C# 中的索引器）与，以及方法的属性不同于属性。The following code example shows how to use the property (the indexer in C#) of the interface with a , and ways the property differs from the property. 该示例表明，，喜欢属性，属性可以更改与现有密钥关联的值，可以使用指定的键是否不在已排序的列表中添加新的键/值对。The example shows that, like the property, the property can change the value associated with an existing key and can be used to add a new key/value pair if the specified key is not in the sorted list. 该示例还表明，与不同属性，属性不会引发异常，如果`key`未在已排序的列表中，返回空引用改为。The example also shows that unlike the property, the property does not throw an exception if `key` is not in the sorted list, returning a null reference instead. 最后，该示例演示获取属性返回空引用，如果`key`不是正确的数据类型，并设置该属性将引发异常，如果`key`不正确的数据类型。Finally, the example demonstrates that getting the property returns a null reference if `key` is not the correct data type, and that setting the property throws an exception if `key` is not the correct data type. 代码示例摘自一个更大的示例，包括输出中，为提供方法。The code example is part of a larger example, including output, provided for the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 集合中的默认实现不同步。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation.

summary.span: 如果元素数小于当前容量的 90%，将容量设置为 中的实际元素数。

span.span: Sets the capacity to the actual number of elements in the , if that number is less than 90 percent of current capacity.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法可用于最小化集合的内存开销如果任何新元素将不添加到集合。This method can be used to minimize a collection's memory overhead if no new elements will be added to the collection. 重新分配和复制较大的成本但是，有时会很大，因此方法不会执行任何操作，如果列表为在多个容量的 90%。The cost of reallocating and copying a large can be considerable, however, so the method does nothing if the list is at more than 90 percent of capacity. 这样可以避免产生相对较小增益的大型的重新分配费用。This avoids incurring a large reallocation cost for a relatively small gain. 此方法为 O (`n`) 操作，其中`n`是。This method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is . 若要重置为其初始状态，请在调用方法之前调用方法。To reset a to its initial state, call the method before calling method. 截去空的容量设置到默认容量。Trimming an empty sets the capacity of the to the default capacity. 也可以使用设置容量属性。The capacity can also be set using the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法将的功能组合方法和属性。This method combines the functionality of the method and the property. 如果未找到该键，则`value`参数的值类型获取适当的默认值`TValue`; 例如，对于整数类型，零 (0)`false`为布尔值类型和`null`对于引用类型。If the key is not found, then the `value` parameter gets the appropriate default value for the value type `TValue`; for example, zero (0) for integer types, `false` for Boolean types, and `null` for reference types. 此方法用于执行二进制搜索;因此，此方法为 O (log `n`) 操作，其中`n`是。This method performs a binary search; therefore, this method is an O(log `n`) operation, where `n` is . ## Examples 该示例演示如何使用方法作为更高效的方法来检索经常尝试不在已排序的列表中的键的程序中的值。The example shows how to use the method as a more efficient way to retrieve values in a program that frequently tries keys that are not in the sorted list. 与之相反，对于该示例还演示如何将属性 （C# 中的索引器） 在尝试检索不存在的键时引发异常。For contrast, the example also shows how the property (the indexer in C#) throws exceptions when attempting to retrieve nonexistent keys. 此代码示例是为提供一个更大示例的一部分类。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 中的值的顺序中的顺序相同。The order of the values in the is the same as the order in the . 返回不是静态副本，而是，表示返回的值在原始。The returned is not a static copy; instead, the refers back to the values in the original . 因此，更改为继续反映在。Therefore, changes to the continue to be reflected in the . 返回的集合属性提供按索引检索值的有效方法。The collection returned by the property provides an efficient way to retrieve values by index. 不需要重新生成列表时访问的属性，因为列表是只是值的内部数组的包装器。It is not necessary to regenerate the list when the property is accessed, because the list is just a wrapper for the internal array of values. 下面的代码演示如何使用属性执行索引检索的字符串的排序列表中的值：The following code shows the use of the property for indexed retrieval of values from a sorted list of strings: [!code-cpp[Generic.SortedList#11](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Generic.SortedList/cpp/remarks.cpp#11)] [!code-csharp[Generic.SortedList#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Generic.SortedList/CS/remarks.cs#11)] [!code-vb[Generic.SortedList#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Generic.SortedList/VB/remarks.vb#11)] 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 此代码示例演示如何枚举在已排序的列表中使用的值属性，以及如何枚举的键和已排序的列表中的值。This code example shows how to enumerate the values in the sorted list using the property, and how to enumerate the keys and values in the sorted list. 该示例还演示如何使用高效索引检索值的属性。The example also shows how to use the property for efficient indexed retrieval of values. 此代码示例是为提供一个更大示例的一部分类。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class.
